definition: gaseous distension of the stomach or intestine
usage: No side effects other than different levels of meteorism, were displayed.

definition: abusive or venomous language to express blame or censure
usage: He is a writer who has often been criticized by the press but never before with such vitriol.

definition: a grotesque product of the imagination
usage: Why do people chase the chimera of fame?

definition: make or shape as with an axe
usage: He never states his own opinion but hews to the party line.

definition: marked by care and persistent effort
usage: It was agreed that the few students sedulous enough to read the book deserved top marks for diligence.

definition: a corrupt or depraved or degenerate act or practice
usage: acts/crimes of moral turpitude

definition: gain the good will of or cause to be more favorably inclined
usage: These changes have been made in an attempt to conciliate critics of the plan.

definition: extremely unpleasant or annoying
usage: George is an insufferable bore, and you know it.

definition: remove by erasing or crossing out or as if by drawing a line
usage: She has been unable to expunge the details of the accident from her memory.

definition: presumptuously arrogant
usage: She is driven by overweening ambition.

definition: take in liquids
usage: Have you been imbibing again?

definition: dissenting with the majority opinion
usage: The Lisbon Treaty was the result of long negotiations among the factious states of Europe.

definition: characterized by great caution
usage: I'm a little chary of using a travel agency that doesn't have official registration.

definition: simple and natural; without cunning or deceit
usage: "Why did you take the money?" she asked the child. "Because I wanted it," came the artless reply.

definition: attract; cause to be enamored
usage: a beguiling smile

definition: bitter or scornful
usage: a saturnine character/look

definition: the farthest point in an orbit around the Earth
usage: At their apogee, the novels of Spillane claimed worldwide sales of over $180 million.

definition: the lowest point of anything
usage: The sun, or any celestial body, is said to be at its nadir when at its lowest point. The opposite, highest point is said to be its zenith.

definition: bring about abruptly
usage: We were alarmed by his precipitate actions.

definition: generally incompetent and ineffectual
usage: He was portrayed as a feckless drunk.

definition: not in keeping with accepted standards of what is proper
usage: I was nervous about what he might do, but nothing untoward happened.

definition: able or tending to extend in one or more directions
usage: The seals form small groups on the expansive beaches where they breed.

definition: comprehensive or broad-minded in tastes and interests
usage: a Catholic school/church

definition: having great mass and weight and unwieldiness
usage: ponderous dialogue

definition: become weaker, in strength, value, or magnitude
usage: The artist has attenuated the limbs.

definition: hasty and without attention to detail; not thorough
usage: She asked a few perfunctory questions about my family and then ended the conversation.

definition: defiantly aggressive
usage: He was a truculent bully.

definition: bear the expenses of
usage: defray costs/expenses A temporary tax rebate was available to help multinational corporations defray their business costs.

definition: wrongful conduct by a public official
usage: corporate/financial/political malfeasance

definition: liveliness and eagerness
usage: He invited us all to visit, and we agreed with alacrity.

definition: easily irritated or annoyed
usage: the fractious nature of politics

definition: a formal ecclesiastical curse accompanied by excommunication
usage: The idea of higher taxes is anathema to most conservatives.

definition: lacking wit or imagination
usage: Only a few prosaic tables and chairs remained by the time we got to the auction.

definition: having a bad disposition; surly
usage: I churlishly told him to go bother someone else.

definition: bend the knees and bow in a servile manner
usage: People say he kowtowed to the establishment to get elected.

definition: thunderous verbal attack
usage: He launched into a long diatribe against the lack of action in Congress.

definition: complete and without qualification
usage: He dismissed the rumors as `arrant nonsense'.

definition: lowest support of a structure
usage: To protect and strengthen nails manicurists use a base coat.

definition: driven by lust
usage: lascivious behavior

definition: a person who is rejected from society or home
usage: Because of its poor human rights record, the country was treated as a pariah by other nations.

definition: showing an inclination to disagree
usage: a contentious subject

definition: language used in a figurative or nonliteral sense
usage: Human-like robots are a classic trope of science fiction.

definition: capable of relieving pain
usage: Somehow this avoids being just another silly pop song with anodyne lyrics about love and happiness.

definition: an event indicating important things to come
usage: His remarkable recovery defied all medical augury.

definition: not worth considering
usage: It was such a trifling sum of money to argue about!

definition: capable of causing fires or catching fire spontaneously
usage: He gave an incendiary speech at last night’s rally.

definition: overly dramatic or emotional
usage: a histrionic performance

definition: strong feelings of embarrassment
usage: She was chagrined to discover her mistake.

definition: produced or marked by conscious design or premeditation
usage: He showed a studied disregard for her concerns.

definition: having excessive asymmetrical ornamentation
usage: Rococo remained popular in the provinces and in Italy until Napoleonic times.

definition: artificially formal or stiff
usage: Legal language tends to be very stilted.

definition: divide voting districts unfairly and to one's advantage
usage: Enlarging the district to dilute the Latino vote is a blatant example of gerrymandering.

definition: taking on different forms
usage: the protean talents of this comedian

definition: free somebody from an erroneous belief
usage: He thought that all women liked children, but she soon disabused him of that (idea/notion).

definition: an intricate and confusing interpersonal situation
usage: The Soviet Union became anxious to withdraw its soldiers from the Afghan imbroglio.

definition: not produced by natural forces; artificial or fake
usage: The excitement was largely factitious and confined to the media.

definition: argue in protest or opposition
usage: The editor remonstrated with him about the inaccuracies in the story.

definition: overtaken by darkness
usage: Some of the early explorers thought of the local people as benighted savages who could be exploited.

definition: putting an end to all debate or action
usage: In his usual peremptory manner, he ordered us all into the conference room.

definition: pleasing to the ear
usage: the mellifluous sound of the cello

definition: affected by yellowing of the skin
usage: He has a jaundiced view of middle-class life.

definition: small and of little importance
usage: The misery suffered in this war makes your own problems seem pretty picayune.

definition: abusive language used to express blame or censure
usage: A stream of invective from some sectors of the press continues to assail the government.

definition: express strong disapproval of
usage: The president excoriated the Western press for their biased views.

definition: not having enough money to pay for necessities
usage: The company suffered huge losses as its young, impecunious buyers failed to start to make payments when the first year of no payments was up.

definition: a manuscript on which more than one text has been written
usage: His performance is a palimpsest in which you see all the layers of a single life.

definition: money extracted as a penalty
usage: The jury mulcted me for $50.

definition: clear and bright
usage: limpid prose

definition: lacking interest or significance or impact
usage: a jejune lecture by one of our professors

definition: make peace with
usage: The radicals in the party were clearly fired to propitiate the conservative core.

definition: warranting only temporal punishment
usage: a venial sin/error

definition: edit by omitting or modifying parts considered indelicate
usage: The book was expurgated to make it suitable for children.

definition: curse or declare to be evil or anathema
usage: I execrate any policy that interferes with the rights and freedoms of others.

definition: concise and full of meaning
usage: The document was sententious and pompous.

definition: model of excellence or perfection of a kind
usage: the apotheosis of the Emperor Trajan

definition: not sensible about practical matters
usage: Many think these attempts to make lawyers behave are quixotic.

definition: widely known and esteemed
usage: an illustrious career

definition: audacious behavior that you have no right to
usage: He was silent all through the meal and then had the effrontery to complain that I looked bored!

definition: summarize briefly
usage: [ T ] The passage recapitulates the version he offers in his prologue.

definition: a person skilled in telling anecdotes
usage: He was a brilliant raconteur.

definition: the act of deceiving or acting in bad faith
usage: They were accused of duplicity in their dealings with both sides.

definition: give instructions to or direct somebody to do something
usage: Lawyers are enjoined to follow high ethical principals.

definition: complete and confirmed integrity
usage: financial/fiscal probity The voting public still demands high standards of financial probity in public life.

definition: boring verbosity
usage: Despite all its absurd prolixity, this is one of the great books in the English language.

definition: be a mystery or bewildering to
usage: I have to say that last question flummoxed me.

definition: beg persistently and urgently
usage: He was arrested for importuning a young boy outside the station.

definition: edit by omitting or modifying parts considered indelicate
usage: The version of the play that I saw had been horribly bowdlerized.

definition: the outward or apparent appearance or form of something
usage: She’s raising two kids, holding down a full-time job, and trying to maintain some semblance of a personal life.

definition: fearless daring
usage: [ + to infinitive ] She had the temerity to call me a liar.

definition: a sign of something about to happen
usage: DNA analysis will help doctors offer better prognostications.

definition: attribute or credit to
usage: The Treasury imputes a notional income from such interest-free loans of 8% a year.

definition: a casual or lighthearted feeling of unconcern
usage: I admired his youthful insouciance.

definition: a socially awkward or tactless act
usage: His failure to ask for his teacher’s advice was a major gaffe.

definition: lofty in style
usage: Her speech was full of grandiloquent language, but it contained no new ideas.

definition: of momentous or ominous significance
usage: The report contains numerous portentous references to a future environmental calamity.

definition: acutely insightful and wise
usage: a sagacious person/comment/choice

definition: any long and tedious address or recital
usage: She had to hear once again his litany of complaints over how badly he was treated.

definition: excessively mournful
usage: a lugubrious face

definition: harsh, bitter, or malicious in tone
usage: He launched a vitriolic attack on the senator, accusing him of shielding corrupt friends.

definition: a person without a home, job, or property
usage: The theater has been left to stand/lie derelict.

definition: relating to or involving money
usage: pecuniary gain/loss An accountant may have to calculate past and future pecuniary loss.

definition: marked by precise accordance with details
usage: He was always punctilious in his manners.

definition: mentally acute or penetratingly discerning
usage: His perspicacious grandfather had bought the land as an investment, guessing that there might be gold underground.

definition: the state of being first in importance
usage: Satellite television, boasting 300 digital channels, was threatening the primacy of cable TV.

definition: a feeling of anger caused by being offended
usage: Will she take umbrage if she isn't invited to the wedding?

definition: a job that involves minimal duties
usage: I never thought of my job as a sinecure.

definition: being on the point of death
usage: The figures show a moribund remortgage market.

definition: a socially awkward or tactless act
usage: a grammatical solecism

definition: ridicule with satire
usage: The skit brilliantly lampoons upper-class society.

definition: official acceptance or agreement
usage: Kids need their fathers’ approbation.

definition: hold spellbound
usage: Her performance was enthralling.

definition: inspiring fear
usage: Tonight he faces the most redoubtable opponent of his boxing career.

definition: harshly ironic or sinister
usage: a mordant remark

definition: relating to or having a deficiency of red blood cells
usage: fig. First-quarter sales were anemic (= weak).

definition: treat with excessive indulgence
usage: disapproving The country has been cosseted (= too protected) by the government for so long that people have forgotten how to take responsibility for themselves.

definition: an inference following from the proof of another proposition
usage: Unfortunately, violence is the inevitable corollary of such a revolutionary change in society.

definition: cut or tear irregularly
usage: [ C ] Justina was treated for a scalp laceration.

definition: lock up or confine, in or as in a jail
usage: Constantly imitating past masters does not take cooking any further forward - it immures it in history.

definition: (of a woman) having the hymen unbroken
usage: For centuries the tomb lay inviolate until, by chance, it was discovered by two miners.

definition: characterized by violent emotions or behavior
usage: They finally stopped seeing each other, ending their tempestuous relationship.

definition: powerful
usage: The king introduced some of his most significant reforms as an advertisement of his own ever more puissant authority.

definition: mutual accusations
usage: [ U ] Western leaders, instead of presenting a coherent policy, have repeatedly lapsed into finger-pointing and recrimination.

definition: of high moral or intellectual value
usage: You get a very rarefied view of things living on a college campus.

definition: the act of giving out in portions
usage: The couple have requested (a) special dispensation from the Church to allow them to marry.

definition: impossible to deny or disprove
usage: irrefutable proof

definition: fair to all parties as dictated by reason and conscience
usage: The tax burden needs to be shared more equitably.

definition: marked by quiet and caution and secrecy
usage: a surreptitious glance

definition: a piece of wood that has been burned or is burning
usage: With firebrands in their hands, they ran to to the murderers' houses, determined to burn them down.

definition: harshness of manner
usage: the asperity of her manner

definition: cause to accept or become hardened to
usage: After spending some time on the island they became inured to the hardships.

definition: a feeling of evil to come
usage: She had had a presentiment of what might lie ahead.

definition: characterized by undue haste and lack of thought
usage: Then, impetuous as I was, I bought a new car before I even got a job.

definition: having or showing arrogant superiority
usage: She was a very imperious, arrogant woman.

definition: traveling especially on foot
usage: a peripatetic music teacher

definition: showing an inappropriate lack of seriousness
usage: We had lost thousands of dollars, so we did not appreciate his flippant remark about "better luck next time."

definition: become bony
usage: Years of easy success had ossified the company's thinking and it never faced up to the challenge of the new technology.

definition: something intended to misrepresent the nature of an activity
usage: His excuse sounded more like subterfuge than a real reason.

definition: humorously vulgar
usage: He entertained us with ribald stories.

definition: containing or implying a slight or showing prejudice
usage: We are not going to seek for invidious comparisons between governments.

definition: express strong disapproval of
usage: Mitchell decried the high rate of unemployment in the state.

definition: impossible to deny or disprove
usage: incontrovertible proof

definition: matchless
usage: Louis Armstrong’s inimitable gravelly voice

definition: overbearing pride or presumption
usage: Hubris brought him down in the end.

definition: of or relating to a civil officer who administers the law
usage: Jenkins's magisterial biography of Gladstone

definition: being of striking appropriateness and pertinence
usage: The film starts in a graveyard, an apposite image for the decaying society which is the theme of the film.

definition: noisily and stubbornly defiant
usage: obstreperous customers

definition: displaying or suggesting a lack of maturity
usage: I find his sense of humor rather puerile.

definition: incapable of being defended or justified
usage: The position of the players’ union has become untenable.

definition: seize and take control without authority
usage: They arrogate to themselves the power to punish people.

definition: threatening or foreshadowing evil or tragic developments
usage: his baleful influence

definition: filled with or evoking sadness
usage: a doleful expression/look

definition: showing little emotion
usage: He is a retired lawyer with a solid, phlegmatic manner.

definition: regret strongly
usage: Researchers at universities are always bemoaning their lack of funds.

definition: of extraterrestrial bodies that hit the earth's atmosphere
usage: The company's meteoric growth sent the stock soaring.

definition: a person who is uninterested in intellectual pursuits
usage: I wouldn't have expected them to enjoy a film of that quality anyway - they're just a bunch of philistines!

definition: not straightforward or candid
usage: a disingenuous compliment

definition: a perfect embodiment of a concept
usage: a paragon of virtue

definition: the reestablishing of cordial relations
usage: [ C ] Both countries have agreed to seek a rapprochement.

definition: defying expression or description
usage: ineffable joy/beauty

definition: a feeling of excessive concern
usage: I'm touched by your solicitude.

definition: something to be imitated
usage: It is an exemplar of a house of the period.

definition: do something that one considers to be below one's dignity
usage: Mr. Clinton did not deign to reply.

definition: the use of deception or trickery
usage: Amazingly for Hollywood, she seems almost entirely without artifice.

definition: creating an unfavorable or neutral first impression
usage: We were disappointed at the unprepossessing exterior of the hotel.

definition: a reappearance of an earlier characteristic
usage: I don't believe the urge to connect with other people is an atavism.

definition: devoid of intelligence
usage: There are so many inane programs on television!

definition: a witty saying
usage: One of Oscar Wilde's most frequently quoted epigrams is "I can resist everything except temptation."

definition: only partly in existence; imperfectly formed
usage: She had a child's inchoate awareness of language.

definition: a short pithy instructive saying
usage: We are all familiar with Tolstoy's apothegm: "Happy families are all alike; every unhappy family is unhappy in its own way."

definition: locating something at a time when it couldn't have existed
usage: He uses only e-mail, never anachronistic regular mail.

definition: having gray or white hair as with age
usage: He told a few hoary old jokes and nobody laughed.

definition: not confined or limited
usage: The Internet allows us untrammeled access to so much information.

definition: become feeble
usage: Traditional industries continue to languish or disappear.

definition: an artificial or inferior substitute or imitation
usage: I'm allowed to eat ersatz chocolate made from carob beans, but it's a poor substitute for the real thing.

definition: a stiff hair
usage: a bristly chin

definition: characterized by lightness and insubstantiality
usage: an ethereal beauty

definition: characteristic of an absolute ruler or absolute rule
usage: an autocratic regime/government/leader

definition: a very intense and uncontrolled fire
usage: The government has turned a minor local problem into a full-blown regional conflagration.

definition: guilt as a confederate in a crime or offense
usage: She is suspected of complicity in the fraud.

definition: someone shirking duty by feigning illness or incapacity
usage: The article gives advice to HR managers on how to deal successfully with malingerers.

definition: show off
usage: The local people like to vaunt the glories of their faded past.

definition: a pauper who lives by begging
usage: Male members of the mendicant orders also acted as nurses in the Middle Ages.

definition: of an angle, between 90 and 180 degrees
usage: I’m not trying to be obtuse, but I don’t get it.

definition: have the financial means to do something or buy something
usage: I can't afford to pay attention to any controversy.

definition: acceptable to the taste or mind
usage: The city council has tried to make property taxes more palatable by giving homeowners more time to pay them.

definition: using words that imitate the sound they denote
usage: Meow purred the cat is an example of onomatopoeia.

definition: a narrow strip of land connecting two larger land areas
usage: An isthmus led the stranded people to the inhabited end of the island.

definition: emitting a smell, especially an unpleasant smell
usage: The odiferous man bought colgne.

definition: in literary criticism, a Bildungsroman is a literary genre that focuses on the psychological and moral growth of the protagonist from youth to adulthood, in which character change is important
usage: Salinger's, The Catcher in the Rye,  is a bildungsroman in that it follows an important experience in the young protagonist's life.

definition: steadiness of mind under stress
usage: She maintained her equanimity throughout her long ordeal.

definition: being quiet or still or inactive
usage: The political situation was now relatively quiescent.

definition: thoughtless;inconsiderate
usage: The city was filled with Incogitant litterbugs.

definition: excessive appetite : greediness
usage: It is then that their true nature is exposed, mired in gulosity and superciliousness as they become.

definition: hairy, bearded, shaggy, unshaven
usage: Hirsute women were enrolled in the study.

definition: written in the form of letters or correspondence
usage: This paper examines the epistolary forms of 1 Corinthians.

definition: the feeling of being bored by something tedious
usage: The whole country seems to be affected by the ennui of winter.

definition: be deliberately ambiguous or unclear
usage: She accused the president of equivocating, claiming that he had deliberately avoided telling the public how bad the problem really was.

definition: understandable only by an enlightened inner circle
usage: Literary readings can sometimes seem esoteric, but we are trying to make them more attractive to more people.

definition: an inoffensive expression substituted for an offensive one
usage: euphemistic words for “dead”

definition: an irreversible accomplishment
usage: The policy change was presented to us as a fait accompli, without consultation or discussion.

definition: giving careful attention to detail
usage: The restaurant offers elaborate food and fastidious service at high prices.

definition: artfully persuasive in speech
usage: He’s not flashy, and he doesn’t know how to be glib.

definition: temperamentally seeking and enjoying the company of others
usage: Leo was an open, gregarious, kind individual, who loved people.

definition: something indicating the approach of something or someone
usage: a harbinger of doom

definition: working or spreading in a hidden and usually injurious way
usage: His negative attitude slowly and insidiously spoiled the atmosphere around the office.

definition: of or relating to amoral or conniving political principles
usage: Most of them, with Machiavellian cunning, were refusing to answer their telephones.

definition: a reply that has no relevance to what preceded it
usage: The professor hesitated for a moment, slightly confused by the question, which seemed on the face of it to be something of a non sequitur.

definition: intended to attract notice and impress others
usage: She waved her hand about, ostentatiously displaying her large diamond ring.

definition: having brief brilliant points or flashes of light
usage: It was a superb script and a scintillating production.

definition: a person who tries to please someone to gain an advantage
usage: The prime minister is surrounded by sycophants.

definition: severely destructive
usage: a cataclysmic eruption/tsunami/earthquake

definition: young and inexperienced
usage: Mark was just a callow youth of 16 when he arrived in Paris.

definition: express a negative opinion of
usage: He spoke disparagingly of his political opponent.

definition: a descendent or heir
usage: He's the scion of a very wealthy newspaper-publishing family.

definition: make better
usage: Foreign aid is badly needed to ameliorate the effects of the drought.

definition: a state of friendship and cordiality
usage: The two groups had lived in perfect amity for many years before the recent troubles.

definition: a move or step or maneuver in political or diplomatic affairs
usage: Whether such a diplomatic démarche would reduce the killing in the area is pure guesswork.

definition: the trait of being unmanageable or uncooperative
usage: a fear of teenage recalcitrance

definition: deny or renounce
usage: to abnegate responsibility/guilt

definition: radiating or as if radiating light
usage: an effulgent smile

definition: of the most contemptible kind
usage: My experiment was an abject failure.

definition: a state or condition markedly different from the norm
usage: The drop in our school’s test scores was dismissed as an aberration.

definition: formally reject or disavow a formerly held belief
usage: He abjured his religion/his life of dissipation.

definition: the denial and rejection of a doctrine or belief
usage: This abnegation of customer care really annoys me.

definition: revoke formally
usage: The opposition party pledged to abrogate the law if they won the election.

definition: run away, often taking something or somebody along
usage: They absconded with $100,000 of the company’s money.

definition: difficult to understand
usage: an abstruse philosophical essay

definition: yield to another's wish or opinion
usage: The diaries were written in 1837, when Queen Victoria acceded to the throne.

definition: approach and speak to someone aggressively or insistently
usage: They were accosted at a bus stop by someone who said he needed money.

definition: an increase by natural growth or addition
usage: accretion of sth All that matters is the quiet accretion of wealth and the dedicated pursuit of commerce.

definition: shrewdness shown by keen insight
usage: commercial/financial/legal acumen

definition: insistent; unwilling to change one's mind or opinion
usage: The mayor adamantly refused to consider a tax increase.

definition: scold or reprimand; take to task
usage: As I left I heard my husband’s admonition – "Don’t be late."

definition: describe roughly or give the main points or summary of
usage: The project's objectives were adumbrated in the report.

definition: in an opposing direction
usage: adverse reaction/side-effect Some people have adverse reactions to additives and preservatives used in many foods.

definition: a person who pleads for a person, cause, or idea
usage: Peer educators can act as enthusiastic advocates for the program and have a sense of purpose in their community outreach efforts.

definition: having an abundant supply of money or possessions of value
usage: Some have argued that ethical food is a sign of an affluent society with a lot of time.

definition: embellish; increase the scope, power, or importance of
usage: She has used that skill to protect her friends and aggrandize herself.

definition: having no definite form or distinct shape
usage: Plans for a 40-acre shopping center section remain so amorphous that the project has been shelved.

definition: chronologically misplaced
usage: Anachronistic mechanical voting machines are gone, replaced with computerized scanners.

definition: of or relating to the period before the biblical flood
usage: My mother has some hopelessly antediluvian ideas about the role of women.

definition: showing little or no emotion or animation
usage: Don't be so apathetic - how are you going to get a job if you don't even start looking?

definition: exact opposite
usage: [ C ] The relaxed company management is the antithesis of a formal bureaucracy.

definition: being of questionable authenticity
usage: It's a good story but I dare say it's apocryphal.

definition: of or relating to or formed by trees
usage: Humans evolved from arboreal ancestors.

definition: requiring secret or mysterious knowledge
usage: They worked hard to negotiate New York's arcane rules for getting on presidential ballots.

definition: of an original type after which other things are patterned
usage: They live in an archetypal country town.

definition: someone who practices self denial as a spiritual discipline
usage: He lived as an ascetic.

definition: a disparaging remark
usage: Gina felt this to contain, in some way, an aspersion upon her ability.

definition: marked by care and persistent effort
usage: The Federal Reserve has been assiduous in the fight against inflation.

definition: a decrease in size of an organ caused by disease or disuse
usage: In the 1980s, their political power gradually atrophied (= became weaker).

definition: something causing misery or death
usage: Instead of doing his homework, my son is always playing computer games – they’re the bane of my existence these days.

definition: lacking or deprived of something
usage: I do hope he won't leave us utterly bereft of his wit and wisdom.

definition: flattery intended to persuade
usage: I must use every kind of blandishment to convince myself that my life and my work are worth while.

definition: cheat somebody out of what is due, especially money
usage: He bilked clients out of tens of millions of dollars.

definition: ostentatiously lofty in style
usage: a bombastic statement

definition: emotionally hardened
usage: As callous as it may sound, trying to help some students is a waste of time.

definition: a false accusation of an offense
usage: He was subjected to the most vicious calumny, but he never complained and never sued.

definition: surrender under agreed conditions
usage: [ C ] This was not a capitulation but an agreement.

definition: engage in boisterous, drunken merrymaking
usage: They were out carousing till dawn.

definition: any of various freshwater fish of the family Cyprinidae
usage: However much people carp about junk mail, many of them read it.

definition: meet to select a candidate or promote a policy
usage: party/Democratic/Republican caucus The amendment would have eliminated the party caucus system for choosing candidates.

definition: play boisterously
usage: A group of teenagers were cavorting in the park.

definition: an indirect way of expressing something
usage: Politicians are experts in circumlocution.

definition: draw a geometric figure around another figure
usage: There followed a series of tightly circumscribed visits to military installations.

definition: surround so as to force to give up
usage: Young people still want to circumvent their parents’ control.

definition: utter or proclaim insistently and noisily
usage: The clamor of their voices rose.

definition: separate or cut with a tool, such as a sharp instrument
usage: [ I ] The volcano cleaved nearly in half after its last eruption.

definition: powerfully persuasive
usage: Her writing combines fluency with cogency.

definition: corresponding in size or degree or extent
usage: The agency’s workload has increased without any commensurate increase in staff.

definition: something added to embellish or make perfect
usage: We had a full complement of reporters and photographers along.

definition: a feeling of deep regret, usually for some misdeed
usage: I would have no compunction about quitting.

definition: following or accompanying as a consequence
usage: Any increase in students means a concomitant increase in money for the university.

definition: the quality of agreeing; being suitable and appropriate
usage: We will assess the degree of congruity between the aims and methods of different agencies.

definition: form intrigues (for) in an underhand manner
usage: He called for an independent investigation to find out whether corrupt officials are being bribed to connive in shoddy construction.

definition: give over to another for care or safekeeping
usage: Most items that you consign to us for sale will be illustrated in our online catalogue.

definition: make sense of; assign a meaning to
usage: That comment could be construed in either of two ways.

definition: feeling or expressing pain or sorrow for sins or offenses
usage: Some of the worst offenders expressed contrition.

definition: go against, as of rules and laws
usage: The toy manufacturer contravened safety codes by using toxic paints on its dolls.

definition: occupied with or fond of the pleasures of good company
usage: The talks ended on a convivial note.

definition: the property of excessive fatness
usage: We know King Henry VIII for his wives, perhaps, or for his corpulence.

definition: extreme greed for material wealth
usage: He does not hide his cupidity, but colleagues resent more the way he flaunts his power.

definition: an insufficient quantity or number
usage: Human Resources managers complain that there is a dearth of talented candidates.

definition: no longer in force or use; inactive
usage: She had once worked for the Traveller hotel chain (now defunct).

definition: a leader who seeks support by appealing to popular passions
usage: While there is truth in this position, as this article has shown, the statement also underrates the role of local demagogues.

definition: attack the good name and reputation of someone
usage: You shouldn't denigrate people just because they have different beliefs from you.

definition: a cruel and oppressive dictator
usage: a despotic regime

definition: so thin as to transmit light
usage: a diaphanous silk veil

definition: instructive, especially excessively
usage: Children’s books possess a practical, didactic purpose – to instill a love for reading.

definition: cause to lose one's composure
usage: This was the source of the stock owners' obligation to avoid discomfiting passengers.

definition: conspicuously and outrageously bad or reprehensible
usage: an egregious example of misrepresentation

definition: a substance with a soothing effect when applied to the skin
usage: an emollient mood/tone

definition: weaken physically, mentally, or morally
usage: The wrestler's plan was to deliver a crushing blow which would enervate his opponent.

definition: call forth
usage: Your book has engendered much controversy.

definition: anything short-lived, as an insect that lives only for a day
usage: ephemeral fame

definition: open to two or more interpretations
usage: She gave an equivocal response.

definition: short-lived; tending to vanish or disappear
usage: We would have all missed the evanescent moment if not for the photographer’s speed and skill.

definition: give expression to
usage: In all the years I knew her, she never evinced any desire to do such a thing.

definition: make worse
usage: Her allergy was exacerbated by the dust.

definition: spur on or encourage especially by cheers and shouts
usage: She exhorted all of us to do our very best.

definition: unequivocally detestable
usage: Some critics praised the acting, but all condemned the execrable plot.

definition: demanding immediate attention
usage: an exigent manager

definition: make amends for
usage: to expiate a crime/sin

definition: not belonging to that in which it is contained
usage: We must not be distracted by extraneous issues, she said.

definition: praise, glorify, or honor
usage: He often extols the virtues of his students.

definition: still in existence; not extinct or destroyed or lost
usage: Phyllis Wheatley is the author of the earliest extant volume of poetry by an African American.

definition: containing or based on incorrect reasoning
usage: His argument is based on fallacious reasoning.

definition: devoid of intelligence
usage: a fatuous remark

definition: a shackle for the ankles or feet
usage: He felt fettered by a nine-to-five office existence.

definition: full of trivial conversation
usage: I had talked too much about myself and felt like a garrulous old fool.

definition: unnecessary and unwarranted
usage: There were too many gratuitous personal insults throughout the debate.

definition: unfortunate and deserving pity
usage: hapless victims of the earthquake

definition: the dominance or leadership of one social group over others
usage: The three nations competed for regional hegemony.

definition: someone who attacks cherished ideas or institutions
usage: Rogers, an iconoclast in architecture, is sometimes described as putting the insides of buildings on the outside.

definition: peculiar to the individual
usage: He follows a very idiosyncratic schedule.

definition: infringe upon
usage: Congress' budget cuts will seriously impinge on the education budget.

definition: impossible to prevent, resist, or stop
usage: Aging is an inexorable process.

definition: not friendly
usage: Excessive managerial control is inimical to creative expression.

definition: a person who takes part in a conversation
usage: The vast majority of our interlocutors from the retail sector indicated that they would not be interested in parallel trade, for fear of spoiling long-term relations with their manufacturers.

definition: a slight suggestion or vague understanding
usage: The book's title gives a fair enough intimation of its subject.

definition: impervious to pleas, persuasion, requests, or reason
usage: He was a man of strong views and intransigent positions.

definition: habitual
usage: an inveterate liar

definition: brief and to the point
usage: “I might,” was the laconic reply.

definition: liberality in bestowing gifts
usage: We've accomplished a great deal through our growing largesse to meaningful non-profit organizations in communities where we do business.

definition: an illusory feat
usage: There are traditional acts of legerdemain with bright scarves and floating balls.

definition: lacking moral discipline
usage: A moralist who decried what she regarded as the licentious and corrupt culture of the entertainment industry.

definition: a powerful circular current of water
usage: It was a country in turmoil, caught up in a maelstrom of change.

definition: effusively or insincerely emotional
usage: The politician’s mawkish speech was so overly sentimental it failed to win him any new votes.

definition: a saying that is widely accepted on its own merits
usage: My grandmother had a wise maxim to help me get through all of my teenage crises.

definition: given to lying
usage: A product claiming to help you get ripped abs in a few hours is mendacious advertising.

definition: a soft wet area of low-lying land that sinks underfoot
usage: The puppy found himself in a morass of being stuck in a tree log.

definition: the conventions embodying the fundamental values of a group
usage: Ignorant of social mores, the man seemed not to know what behaviors were appropriate for a first date.

definition: very generous
usage: The wealthy actor always gives the members of his staff munificent appreciation gifts.

definition: any new participant in some activity
usage: As a first time legislator, Fred was viewed as a neophyte by the senior elected officials.

definition: offensively malodorous
usage: Janice refuses to ride in her boyfriend’s car until he cleans it with something that will eliminate the noisome smell.

definition: stubbornly persistent in wrongdoing
usage: Although the hurricane was rapidly coming their way, the townspeople were obdurate and did not leave their homes..

definition: make obscure or unclear
usage: Because I am a sympathetic teacher, I avoid using language which will obfuscate my students.

definition: intrusive in a meddling or offensive manner
usage: Fred doesn’t like it when officious strangers try to start a conversation in the checkout line.

definition: lessen or to try to lessen the seriousness or extent of
usage: Perhaps a nap will palliate my headache.

definition: hypothetical remedy for all ills or diseases
usage: Alcohol is an antidepressant and not a panacea for emotional troubles.

definition: an insufficient quantity or number
usage: I did not have enough to drink because Sally left only a paucity of soda in the bottle.

definition: expressing disapproval
usage: Although the writer meant to be kind, his words implied a pejorative point of view.

definition: transparently clear; easily understandable
usage: The contract was pellucid and left no confusion about each party's responsibilities.

definition: exceedingly harmful
usage: Jake's pernicious behavior is going to put him in the hospital one of these days.

definition: stubbornly unyielding
usage: Although George has failed his driver’s test six times, his pertinacious spirit will not allow her to stop trying.

definition: concise and full of meaning
usage: The title of your book should be pithy and unforgettable.

definition: a trite or obvious remark
usage: Our coach used every platitude she could think of to make us feel better after our big loss.

definition: enthusiastic approval
usage: Jamie Oliver deserves some plaudits for using his celebrity status to good effect.

definition: extreme excess
usage: Since the recent elections, there has been a plethora of anti-government sentiment.

definition: a powerful ruler, especially one who is unconstrained by law
usage: King Henry made himself the potentate of his realm by killing anyone who dared to question his decisions.

definition: walk all the way around (something)
usage: The man had to circumambulate the perimeter wall.

definition: a foreboding about what is about to happen
usage: If the unpopular president is reelected, his win will presage a countrywide protest.

definition: unrestrained by convention or morality
usage: Phil made a lot of profligate purchases after winning the bingo.

definition: state or announce
usage: The purpose of the documentary is to promulgate the importance of raising funds for additional cancer research.

definition: characterized by lust
usage: As soon as the strange shoe salesman showed a prurient interest in my feet, I ran from the shop.

definition: ready and able to resort to force or violence
usage: The pugnacious little boy constantly talks back to his mother.

definition: physical beauty, especially of a woman
usage: Although this actress is not a woman of great pulchritude, her vast talent has won her more awards than anyone else in the business.

definition: stubbornly resistant to authority or control
usage: Despite being offered treats by his parents, the little boy was still recalcitrant about doing his homework.

definition: a person without moral scruples
usage: Stanley was a reprobate judge who could be bribed with astonishing ease.

definition: excessively or hypocritically pious
usage: The sanctimonious religious leader preached about morality.

definition: confidently optimistic and cheerful
usage: They are less sanguine about the prospects for peace.

definition: expressing offensive, insulting, or scandalous criticism
usage: He posted every rumor sent his way, no matter how scurrilous or unhelpful.

definition: an apparatus for visual signaling
usage: When a semaphore is used, the arm means red when horizontal and white when in an inclined position.

definition: good luck in making unexpected and fortunate discoveries
usage: Serendipity plays a huge role in her art and life.

definition: full of anxiety and concern
usage: He made a solicitous inquiry after her health.
